intro: Baphia goossensii, commonly known as the African velvet tamarind, is a deciduous shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Caesalpiniaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant produces elongated pods containing flat, edible seeds that are used in traditional medicine and cuisine. Its botanical features include hairy foliage and a distinctive, often branched stem structure. Baphia goossensii thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to seasonal rainfall patterns in its native habitat.
